messages: 9ac93fad7c9a77617c9831c44389c55b (14:28): 8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81: if we could figure out how the index should be organized, i'd be happy to start doing the boring work :)
9ac93fad7c9a77617c9831c44389c55b (14:29): hmm, can't figure out the clone URL for that repo
9ac93fad7c9a77617c9831c44389c55b (14:30): AryehGregor: ^^
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:44): 8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81, so what features of Anolis are we using that pimp my spec does not have?
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (14:45): xspecxref.py and refs.py
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:45): cross-spec xref?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:45): oh, references
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:45): right
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:46): hmm
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:47): i guess either I have to get this to run locally or just lose those features for now
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:47): until b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea catches up :)
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:47): having cross-spec xref and references would be neat -- though not sure how they work with a web interface
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (14:47): Pubrules will probably want more detailed references, though
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:48): no
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:48): see e.g. XMLHttpRequest
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (14:49): Works for me, then
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:49): yeah, it just doesn't for me :/
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (15:02): I think it shouldn't be too hard to get the json files somewhere on the server where anolis can find them
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (15:02): and how do we update them then?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (15:03): yeah, I guess we can provide patches
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (15:04): They shouldn't change too often
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (15:11): 73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46, new thread next time?
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (15:12): yeah, sorry
040342c014ffc1c11592948bd92e3721 (15:23): hey, I am surprised you sent a link to the Checklist to the WHATWG - how come?
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (15:24): because I want to get wider feedback on that doc

040342c014ffc1c11592948bd92e3721 (15:24): I would have understood a link to the requirements list, which is in good shape - but the checklist is so much still in raw format, I'm not sure input is helpful at this stage...
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (15:24): we have so far gotten almost zero feedback on it
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (15:25): we have not gotten much feedback on the requirements either
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (15:25): and we need to have a sense of urgency about that
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (15:25): we do not have infinite amounts of time to get implementors to wait for us
040342c014ffc1c11592948bd92e3721 (15:27): ok, I can see where you're coming from
040342c014ffc1c11592948bd92e3721 (15:27): I'm just wondering if feedback to the checklist can be useful at this stage
040342c014ffc1c11592948bd92e3721 (15:27): we've had some edits earlier this week, which I had to remove again because they were solution-specific rather than general technology area
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (15:29): 040342c014ffc1c11592948bd92e3721: What is the value proposition in not getting feedback?
040342c014ffc1c11592948bd92e3721 (15:29): it's in an intermediate state - all the feedback at this stage can be only on the requirements realistically, which has its own page
040342c014ffc1c11592948bd92e3721 (15:30): the whole page will be re-organised by technology still to become actual checklists
040342c014ffc1c11592948bd92e3721 (15:31): getting feedback on the requirements would be awesome though
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (15:31): 040342c014ffc1c11592948bd92e3721: It sounds like feedback now is a great idea
040342c014ffc1c11592948bd92e3721 (15:32): it's not feedback then, but rather input
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (15:32): No point in doing a big refactoring of things people don't like
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (15:32): Is there a difference?
040342c014ffc1c11592948bd92e3721 (15:33): what refactoring? there is no refactoring - it's about making checklists that make sense from a technology POV rather than a disability POV
040342c014ffc1c11592948bd92e3721 (15:34): also, one obvious critique right now is on the priorities - none of which have been discussed or consciously set yet
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (15:35): well, there are no priorities
040342c014ffc1c11592948bd92e3721 (15:36): yup, that's another thing that is on the todo for this page still - it's on the agenda
040342c014ffc1c11592948bd92e3721 (15:36): but anyway - I'm sure the "feedback" will be good input into the process, so go ahead :)
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (15:48): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9, abarth: http://www.w3.org/Bugs/Public/show_bug.cgi?id=10630
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:49): 73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46: does that one have known site impact?
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (15:50): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: no, not afaik
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (15:51): we had an old bug about <div><frameset> (with url still working), but that's ok with the current spec
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (15:54): http://econsultancy.com/uk/blog/6573-why-it-s-time-to-pay-attention-to-html5 -- lol
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (15:54): "According to numerous sources, the balls were indeed in HTML5, specifically CSS3, part of the standard."
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (15:55): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: iirc Refresh works as a real header at least in some browsers
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:55): 73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46: for which values of some?
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (15:55): don't remember
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (15:55): possibly all
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:00): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: maybe my suggestion for limiting the active formatting element growth could be modified not to affect conforming content
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:01): by not removing the formatting elements from the stack when removing them from the list
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (16:01): or removing only elements that are obsolete :)

b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:02): 73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46: curbing <font> growth is certainly the most important motivation here, but letting e.g. <i> grow insanely for DoS wouldn't be nice
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (16:03): it wasn't a serious suggestion :)
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (16:04): with your proposal it's still easy to cause a DoS, just have different attributes on each element
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (16:04): <font 1><font 2> etc
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:04): 73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46: good point
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:05): I wonder if setting n to 0 and thus removing all duplicates from the list would break the Web
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:11): hmm. not removing from stack would required corresponding changes to the AAA
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:12): since currently the AAA can't close an element that's not on the list
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:14): too bad that simply banning duplicates would break the fancy pages that do nested emphasis and de-italicize the inner one
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:15): we could allow two duplicates...
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:15): actually, I like that more than picking a permitted length since the marker
